symbols.name: sap.ui.test.matchers.Interactable
symbols.description:
Checks if a control is currently able to take user interactions. OPA5 will automatically apply this matcher if you specify actions in {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor}. A control will be filtered out by this matcher when:
  • The control is invisible
  • The control or its parents are busy
  • The control is hidden behind a dialog
  • The UIArea of the control needs new rendering
  • As of version 1.53, the Interactable matcher no longer uses internal autoWait functionality.
  • Interactable matcher might be made private in the near future.
  • It is recommended to enable autoWait OPA option instead of using the Interactable matcher directly.
  • The Interactable matcher doesn't check if a control is enabled or editable. One way to check for these properties is with matchers such as the {@link sap.ui.test.matchers.PropertyStrictEquals} and {@link sap.ui.test.matchers.Properties} matchers. Another way is to use the `enabled` and `editable` properties of {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor}. Note that `enabled` is available as of version 1.66, and `editable` is available as of version 1.80.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa
symbols.description: One Page Acceptance testing.

parameters.name: extensionObject
parameters.description: An object containing properties and functions. The newly created Opa will be extended by these properties and functions using jQuery.extend.

constructor.description: This class will help you write acceptance tests in one page or single page applications. You can wait for certain conditions to be met.

properties.name: and
properties.description: "and" property for chaining actions and assertions

properties.name: assert
properties.description:
A map of QUnit-style assertions to be used in an opaTest. Contains all methods available on QUnit.assert for the running QUnit version. Available assertions are: ok, equal, propEqual, deepEqual, strictEqual and their negative counterparts.

For more information, see {@link module:sap/ui/test/opaQunit}.

properties.name: config
properties.description:
The global configuration of Opa. The subset of the global values defined in {@link sap.ui.test.Opa.BaseParameters}.can be overwritten in an individual waitFor call. The default values for the global configuration are:
  • arrangements: A new Opa instance
  • actions: A new Opa instance
  • assertions: A new Opa instance
  • timeout : 15 seconds, 0 for infinite timeout
  • pollingInterval: 400 milliseconds
  • debugTimeout: 0 seconds, infinite timeout by default. This will be used instead of timeout if running in debug mode.
  • asyncPolling: false
You can either directly manipulate the config, or extend it using {@link sap.ui.test.Opa.extendConfig}.

methods.name: emptyQueue
methods.description: Calls the static emptyQueue function in the Opa namespace {@link sap.ui.test.Opa.emptyQueue}

returnValue.description: If the waiting was successful, the promise will be resolved. If not it will be rejected

methods.description: Waits until all waitFor calls are done.

methods.description: Calls the static extendConfig function in the Opa namespace {@link sap.ui.test.Opa.extendConfig}

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The values to be added to the existing config

methods.name: getContext

returnValue.description: the context object

methods.description: Gives access to a singleton object you can save values in. This object will only be created once and it will never be destroyed. That means you can use it to save values you need in multiple separated tests.

methods.name: getContext

returnValue.description: the context object

methods.description: Gives access to a singleton object you can save values in. Same as {@link sap.ui.test.Opa#getContext}

methods.name: iWaitForPromise

returnValue.description: promise which is the result of a {@link sap.ui.test.Opa#waitFor}

parameters.name: oPromise
parameters.description: promise to schedule on the OPA queue

methods.description: Schedule a promise on the OPA queue.The promise will be executed in order with all waitFors - any subsequent waitFor will be executed after the promise is done. The promise is not directly chained, but instead its result is awaited in a new waitFor statement. This means that any "thenable" should be acceptable.

methods.name: resetConfig
methods.description:
Reset Opa.config to its default values. All of the global values can be overwritten in an individual waitFor call. The default values are:
  • arrangements: A new Opa instance
  • actions: A new Opa instance
  • assertions: A new Opa instance
  • timeout : 15 seconds, 0 for infinite timeout
  • pollingInterval: 400 milliseconds
  • debugTimeout: 0 seconds, infinite timeout by default. This will be used instead of timeout if running in debug mode.
  • executionDelay: 0 or 50 (depending on the browser). The value is a number representing milliseconds. The executionDelay will slow down the execution of every single waitFor statement to be delayed by the number of milliseconds. This does not effect the polling interval it just adds an initial pause. Use this parameter to slow down OPA when you want to watch your test during development or checking the UI of your app. It is not recommended to use this parameter in any automated test executions.
  • asyncPolling: false

methods.name: stopQueue
methods.description: Clears the queue and stops running tests so that new tests can be run. This means all waitFor statements registered by {@link sap.ui.test.Opa#waitFor} will not be invoked anymore and the promise returned by {@link sap.ui.test.Opa.emptyQueue} will be rejected When it is called inside of a check in {@link sap.ui.test.Opa#waitFor} the success function of this waitFor will not be called.

methods.name: waitFor

returnValue.description: an object extending a jQuery promise. The object is essentially a jQuery promise with an additional "and" method that can be used for chaining waitFor statements. The promise is resolved when the waitFor completes successfully. The promise is rejected with the options object, if an error occurs. In this case, options.errorMessage will contain a detailed error message containing the stack trace and Opa logs.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: configuration options

methods.description:
Queues up a waitFor command for Opa. The Queue will not be emptied until {@link sap.ui.test.Opa.emptyQueue} is called. If you are using {@link module:sap/ui/test/opaQunit}, emptyQueue will be called by the wrapped tests.

If you are using Opa5, waitFor takes additional parameters. They can be found here: {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor}. Waits for a check condition to return true, in which case a success function will be called. If the timeout is reached before the check returns true, an error function will be called.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa.BaseParameters
symbols.description: Configuration parameters for Opa.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (seconds) Specifies how long the waitFor function polls before it fails. The default value is 15 seconds, 0 means it will wait forever.

properties.name: debugTimeout
properties.description: (seconds) @since 1.47 Specifies how long the waitFor function polls before it fails in debug mode. 0 means it will wait forever.

properties.name: pollingInterval
properties.description: (milliseconds) Specifies how often the waitFor function polls. The default is 400ms.

properties.name: asyncPolling
properties.description: @since 1.55 Enable asynchronous polling after success() call. This allows more stable autoWaiter synchronization with event flows originating from within success(). Especially useful to stabilize synchronization with overflow toolbars. False by default.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa.Config
symbols.description: The global configuration of Opa.

properties.name: arrangements
properties.description: A new Opa instance

properties.name: actions
properties.description: A new Opa instance

properties.name: assertions
properties.description: A new Opa instance

properties.name: executionDelay
properties.description: The value is a number representing milliseconds. The default values are 0 or 50 (depending on the browser). The executionDelay will slow down the execution of every single waitFor statement to be delayed by the number of milliseconds. This does not effect the polling interval it just adds an initial pause. Use this parameter to slow down OPA when you want to watch your test during development or checking the UI of your app. It is not recommended to use this parameter in any automated test executions.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa.WaitForOptions
symbols.description: Configuration parameters for an individual {@link sap.ui.test.Opa#waitFor} call.

properties.name: check
properties.description: Will get invoked in every polling interval. If it returns true, the check is successful and the polling will stop. The first parameter passed into the function is the same value that gets passed to the success function. Returning something other than boolean in the check will not change the first parameter of success.

properties.name: success
properties.description: Will get invoked after the check function returns true. If there is no check function defined, it will be directly invoked. waitFor statements added in the success handler will be executed before previously added waitFor statements.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: Will be displayed as an errorMessage depending on your unit test framework. Currently the only adapter for Opa is QUnit. This message is displayed there if Opa has reached its timeout but QUnit has not yet reached it.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa5
symbols.description:
UI5 extension of the OPA framework.

Helps you when writing tests for UI5 apps. Provides convenience to wait and retrieve for UI5 controls without relying on global IDs. Makes it easy to wait until your UI is in the state you need for testing, for example waiting for back-end data.

Creates a set of page objects, each consisting of actions and assertions and adds them to the Opa configuration.

Use page objects to structure your actions and assertions based on parts of the screen. This helps to avoid name clashes and to structure your tests.

This function is designed to make the test's teardown independent of the startup. The promise is not directly chained, but instead its result is awaited in a new waitFor statement. This means that any "thenable" should be acceptable.

methods.name: resetConfig
methods.description:
Resets Opa.config to its default values. See {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor} for the description Default values for OPA5 are:
  • viewNamespace: empty string
  • arrangements: instance of OPA5
  • actions: instance of OPA5
  • assertions: instance of OPA5
  • visible: true
  • enabled: false
  • editable: false
  • timeout : 15 seconds, 0 for infinite timeout
  • pollingInterval: 400 milliseconds
  • debugTimeout: 0 seconds, infinite timeout by default. This will be used instead of timeout if running in debug mode.
  • autoWait: false - since 1.42
  • appParams: object with URI parameters for the tested app - since 1.48

methods.name: stopQueue
methods.description: Clears the queue and stops running tests so that new tests can be run. This means all waitFor statements registered by {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor} will not be invoked anymore and the promise returned by {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5.emptyQueue} will be rejected. When its called inside of a check in {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor} the success function of this waitFor will not be called.

The promise is resolved when the waitFor completes successfully. The promise is rejected with the options object, if an error occurs. In this case, options.errorMessage will contain a detailed error message containing the stack trace and Opa logs.

symbols.description: An action simulates user interaction on a control

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa5.BaseParameters
symbols.description: Configuration parameters for Opa5.

properties.name: viewNamespace
properties.description: viewName prefix. Recommended to be set in {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5.extendConfig} instead.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: If set to false, Opa5 will also look for unrendered and invisible controls.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description:
@since 1.66 If set to false, Opa5 will look for both enabled and disabled controls. Note that this option's default value is related to the autoWait mechanism:
  • When autoWait is enabled globally or in the current waitFor, the default value for options.enabled is true.
  • When autoWait is not used, the default value for options.enabled is false.
This means that if you use autoWait and you want to find a disabled control, you need to explicitly set options.enabled to false.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: @since 1.80 If set to true, Opa5 will match only editable controls. If set to false, Opa5 will match both editable and non-editable controls.

properties.name: autoWait

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa5.Config
symbols.description: The global configuration of Opa5.

properties.name: arrangements
properties.description: A new Opa5 instance

properties.name: actions
properties.description: A new Opa5 instance

properties.name: assertions
properties.description: A new Opa5 instance

properties.name: executionDelay
properties.description: The value is a number representing milliseconds. The default values are 0 or 50 (depending on the browser). The executionDelay will slow down the execution of every single waitFor statement to be delayed by the number of milliseconds. This does not effect the polling interval it just adds an initial pause. Use this parameter to slow down OPA when you want to watch your test during development or checking the UI of your app. It is not recommended to use this parameter in any automated test executions.

properties.name: appParams
properties.description: object with URI parameters for the tested app - since 1.48

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa5.ControlsBaseSelector
symbols.description: Configuration parameters for an individual {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor} call.

properties.name: viewName
properties.description: The name of a view. If viewName is set, controls will be searched only inside this view. If control ID is given, it will be considered to be relative to the view.

properties.name: viewId
properties.description: @since 1.62 The ID of a view. Can be used alone or in combination with viewName and viewNamespace. * Always set view ID if there are multiple views with the same name.

properties.name: fragmentId
properties.description: @since 1.63 The ID of a fragment. If set, controls will match only if their IDs contain the fragment ID prefix.

properties.name: matchers
controlType
searchOpenDialogs
properties.description: If set to true, Opa5 will only look in open dialogs. All the other values except control type will be ignored

properties.name: interactable
properties.description: @since 1.80 If set to true, the {@link sap.ui.test.matchers.Interactable} matcher will be applied. If autoWait is true, this option has no effect and interactable will always be true. If autoWait is false, which is the default state, the value of the interactable property will have an effect. When interactable is true, enabled will also be set to true, unless declared otherwise.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Invoked when the timeout is reached and the check never returned true.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: Will be displayed as an errorMessage depending on your unit test framework. Currently the only adapter for Opa5 is QUnit. This message is displayed if Opa5 has reached its timeout before QUnit has reached it.

properties.name: actions

symbols.description: Matchers used to filter controls.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa5.MultiControlSelector
symbols.description: Configuration parameters for an individual {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor} call. Contain criteria for selecting one or multiple controls.

properties.name: id
check
properties.description: Will get invoked in every polling interval. If it returns true, the check is successful and the polling will stop. The first parameter passed into the function is the same value that gets passed to the success function. Returning something other than boolean in check will not change the first parameter of success.

properties.name: success
properties.description:
Will get invoked after the following conditions are met:
  1. One or multiple controls were found using controlType, Id, viewName. If visible is true (it is by default), the controls also need to be rendered.
  2. The whole matcher pipeline returned true for at least one control, or there are no matchers
  3. The check function returned true, or there is no check function
The first parameter passed into the function is an array of controls (viewName, controlType, multiple ID's, regex ID's) that matched all matchers. Matchers can alter the array to something different. Please read the documentation of waitFor's matcher parameter.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.Opa5.SingleControlSelector
symbols.description: Configuration parameters for an individual {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor} call.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The global ID of a control, or the ID of a control inside a view.

properties.name: check
properties.description: Will get invoked in every polling interval. If it returns true, the check is successful and the polling will stop. The first parameter passed into the function is the same value that gets passed to the success function. Returning something other than boolean in check will not change the first parameter of success.

properties.name: success
properties.description:
Will get invoked if the following conditions are met:
  1. A control was found using viewName and Id that maches any addiotnally specified criteria e.g. controlType, matchers. If visible is true (it is by default), the control also needs to be rendered.
  2. The check function returned true, or there is no check function

methods.name: getControlByGlobalId

returnValue.description:
all matching controls
  • if a oOptions.id is a string, will return the single matching control or null if no controls match
  • otherwise, will return an array of matching controls, or an empty array, if no controls match

parameters.name: oOptions

id.name: id
id.description: required - ID to match. Can be string, regex or array

parameters.description: a map of match conditions. Must contain an id property

methods.description: Find a control by its global ID.

methods.name: getControlConstructor

returnValue.description: When the type is loaded, the constructor is returned, if it is a lazy stub or not yet loaded, null will be returned and there will be a log entry.

parameters.name: sControlType
parameters.description: the name of the type eg: "sap.m.Button"

methods.description: Gets the constructor function of a certain controlType

methods.name: getControlInView

returnValue.description:
If oOptions.id is a string, will return the control with such an ID or null.
If the view is not found or no control matches the given criteria, will return an empty array
Otherwise, will return an array of matching controls

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: can contain a viewName, viewNamespace, viewId, fragmentId, id and controlType properties.

methods.description:
Gets a control inside the view (same as calling oView.byId) Returns all matching controls inside a view (also nested views and their children).
The view can be specified by viewName, viewNamespace, viewId, and any combination of three. eg : { id : "foo" } will search globally for a control with the ID foo
eg : { id : "foo" , viewName : "bar" } will search for a control with the ID foo inside the view with the name bar
eg : { viewName : "bar" } will return all the controls inside the view with the name bar
eg : { viewName : "bar", controlType : sap.m.Button } will return all the Buttons inside a view with the name bar
eg : { viewName : "bar", viewNamespace : "baz." } will return all the Controls in the view with the name baz.bar
eg : { viewId : "viewBar" } will return all the controls inside the view with the ID viewBar

methods.name: getMatchingControls

returnValue.description:
• if a oOptions.id is a string, will return the single matching control or null if no controls match
  • otherwise, will return an array of matching controls, or an empty array, if no controls match

parameters.name: oOptions

viewName.name: viewName
viewName.description: Controls will only be searched inside this view (ie: the view (as a control) has to be an ancestor of the control) If a control ID is given, the control will be found using the byId function of the view.

viewId.name: viewId
viewId.description: @since 1.62 Controls will only be searched inside this view (ie: the view (as a control) has to be an ancestor of the control) If a control ID is given, the control will be found using the byId function of the view.

id.name: id
id.description: The ID of one or multiple controls. This can be a global ID or an ID used together with viewName. See the documentation of this parameter.

visible.name: visible
visible.description: should the control have a visible DOM reference

interactable.name: interactable
interactable.description: @since 1.34 should the control be interactable and enabled. When true, only interactable and enabled controls will be matched. For details, see the {@link sap.ui.test.matchers.Interactable} matcher.

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.description: @since 1.66 should the control be enabled. If interactable is true, enabled will also be true, unless declared otherwise.

searchOpenDialogs.name: searchOpenDialogs
searchOpenDialogs.description: Only controls in the static UI area of UI5 are searched.

controlType.name: controlType

parameters.description: a map of options used to describe the control you are looking for.

methods.description: Find a control matching the provided options

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.test.OpaPlugin.

methods.name: getView

returnValue.description: Unique view or undefined

parameters.name: sViewName
parameters.description: Name of the view

methods.description: Returns the view with a specific name. The result should be a unique view. If there are multiple visible views with that name, none will be returned.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.PageObjectDefinition
symbols.description: Settings for a new page object, consisting of actions and assertions.

properties.name: viewName
viewId
properties.description: When a viewId is given, all waitFor calls inside of the page object will get a viewId parameter. Use when there are multiple views with the same viewName.

properties.name: baseClass
properties.description: Base class for the page object's actions and assertions

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: Namespace prefix for the page object's actions and assertions. Use it if you use page objects from multiple projects in the same test build.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: A map or a class of functions that can be used as arrangement or action in Opa tests. Only the test decides whether a function is used as arrangement or action. Each function typically contains one or multiple waitFor statements.

properties.name: assertions
properties.description: A map or a class of functions that can be used as assertions in Opa tests.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.PageObjectFactory
symbols.description: Page Object Factory.

methods.name: create

returnValue.description: Map of created page objects

parameters.name: mPageDefinitions
parameters.description: Definitions of 1 or more page objects

parameters.name: Opa5
parameters.description: Opa5 class, provided as parameter to avoid a circular dependency

methods.description:
Creates a set of page objects, each consisting of actions and assertions, and adds them to the Opa configuration.

Use page objects to structure your actions and assertions based on parts of the screen. This helps to avoid name clashes and to structure your tests.

symbols.name: sap.ui.test.RecordReplay
symbols.description: Record-and-replay implementation for OPA5.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.test.RecordReplay with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.

methods.name: findAllDOMElementsByControlSelector

returnValue.description: Promise to be resolved with an array of DOM elements or rejected with Error when no suitable DOM elements are found

parameters.name: oOptions

selector.name: selector
selector.description: Control selector for this control Could be the result of {@link sap.ui.test.RecordReplay.findControlSelectorByDOMElement} If the selector matches multiple controls, all of their representations will be included in the result. If the selector contains ID suffix for a DOM element, the result will include the first DOM element with a matching ID (one DOM element per control). Otherwise, the result will include the first DOM element with ID matching the control's ID, or the DOM element that usually receives focus events (one DOM element per control).

parameters.description: Options for the search

methods.description: Find DOM element representations of all controls specified by a selector object. Useful when the selector matches multiple controls and you want all the results.

methods.name: findControlSelectorByDOMElement

returnValue.description: Promise for control selector or error

parameters.name: oOptions

domElement.name: domElement
domElement.description: DOM element that was pointed out by the user

settings.name: settings

preferViewId.name: preferViewId
preferViewId.description: true if selectors with view ID should have higher priority than selectors with global ID. Default value is false. If one selector is requested, and there are two valid selectors - with view ID and global ID, the one with view ID should be returned.

settings.description: preferences for the selector e.g. which is the most prefered strategy

parameters.description: Options to influence the generation of the selector

methods.description: Find the best control selector for a DOM element. A selector uniquely represents a single element. The 'best' selector is the one with which it is most likely to uniquely identify a control with the least possible inspection of the control tree.

methods.name: findDOMElementByControlSelector

returnValue.description: Promise to be resolved with DOM element or rejected with Error when no suitable representation can be found

parameters.name: oOptions

selector.name: selector
selector.description: Control selector for this control Could be the result of {@link sap.ui.test.RecordReplay.findControlSelectorByDOMElement} If the selector matches multiple controls, only the first one will be used If the selector contains ID suffix for a DOM element, the 'first' relevant DOM element will be located Otherwise, the result will be the 'first' DOM element with ID matching the control's or the one that usually receives focus events

parameters.description: Options for the search

methods.description: Find DOM element representation of a control specified by a selector object.

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

interactionType.name: interactionType
interactionType.description: Interaction type; Currently supported interaction types are {@link sap.ui.test.RecordReplay.InteractionType} To see the interaction details and options, see {@link sap.ui.test.actions}

pressEnterKey.name: pressEnterKey

keepFocus.name: keepFocus
keepFocus.description: If the input will remain focused after text is entered

parameters.description: Options for the interaction

methods.name: waitForUI5

returnValue.description: Promise to be resolved when UI5 is awaited, or rejected if timeout is reached The promise will be rejected with an error containing a stringified list of pending work.

parameters.name: oOptions

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.description: Time in milliseconds to wait until processing is complete

interval.name: interval
interval.description: Time in milliseconds to wait between checks

parameters.description: Override default wait options like polling timeout and interval

methods.description: Wait for UI5 to complete processing, poll until all asynchronous work is finished, or timeout.
